column2: After centuries of rule, the Caliphate is losing its hold on Persia and the Levant. Various Persian rulers compete with each other, each more eager than the last to crown himself the Shah of Persia. Meanwhile, the Abbasid decline provides an opportunity for Byzantine empire to reclaim lands lost to the Muslims.n  In Europe, Henry the Fowler will soon leave his throne to the future emperor Otto the Great, Norway is ruled by a Christian king, and Abd-ar-Rahman III guides Cordoba through its golden age as a self-declared Caliph and Commander of the Faithful.
